attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/nomad421|@nomad421>: Fascinating looking new method / tool <https://github.com/ekimb/rust-mdbg> --- De Bruijn Graphs in minimizer space.  Led by <https://twitter.com/gunesaynasinda|@gunesaynasinda>, in collab with <https://twitter.com/RayanChikhi|@RayanChikhi> and Bonnie Berger.  I'm really looking forward to the paper (Recomb '21); and glad to see the impl in <https://twitter.com/rustlang|@rustlang>!!
attachments.text: Fascinating looking new method / tool <https://github.com/ekimb/rust-mdbg> --- De Bruijn Graphs in minimizer space.  Led by <https://twitter.com/gunesaynasinda|@gunesaynasinda>, in collab with <https://twitter.com/RayanChikhi|@RayanChikhi> and Bonnie Berger.  I'm really looking forward to the paper (Recomb '21); and glad to see the impl in <https://twitter.com/rustlang|@rustlang>!!

text: Looks nice, but I'm not sure what the use case is. It promises decent results with high depth, and low computational cost. But usually, getting high depth is more expensive than just buying more compute, so it makes more sense to just use HiCanu and wait. Maybe RAM consumption gets really tough with high coverage?
